clinical_study.brief_title: Safer Use of Medication in Pediatric Patients at Home
clinical_study.official_title: Safer Use of Medication in Pediatric Patients at Home: Error Reporting Website

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims:
- to develop a web-based notification system for caregivers of pediatric patients that allows to report medication errors and, based on this notification, and to share experiences and alerts about common errors of patients.
- to assess de user satisfaction and perceived usefulness of the system.
Participants:
Parents with children who have required drug treatment in the last two months, who have an Internet connection and who agree to participate in the study.
Sample size: 62 participants
Main outcome variable: overall satisfaction

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with the web-based medication error notification system
primary_outcome.time_frame: At one month after use of the website
primary_outcome.description: Overall satisfaction with the web-based medication error notification system by an ad hoc questionnaire

clinical_study.condition: Medication Errors and Other Product Use Errors and Issues

intervention.description: The study group uses a web-based medication error notification system

study_pop.textblock: Parents or caregivers of children aged from 0 to 14 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- To care children aged under 14 years who have required drug treatment in the last two months
- To have an Internet connection
- To agree to participate in the study.
- To be registered in the study web-based notification system
- Age > 17 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- To be health provider
- To care children in residence for minors.
- To care children with a life expectancy of less than 2 years.
